abstract: A collection that represents a selection of contiguous elements from a typed column.
overview:
## Overview

A column slice contains only certain elements from its parent column. Create a slice by using a subscript with a range.

source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/TabularData/ColumnSlice
crawled: 2025-12-03T05:05:41Z
---

# ColumnSlice

**Structure**

A collection that represents a selection of contiguous elements from a typed column.

## Declaration

```swift
struct ColumnSlice<WrappedElement>
```

## Overview

A column slice contains only certain elements from its parent column. Create a slice by using a subscript with a range.

```swift
let slice = column[100 ..< 200]
```

## Creating a Column Slice

- **init(_:)**: Creates a slice with the contents of a column.

## Creating a Slice of Unique Elements

- **distinct()**: Generates a discontiguous slice that contains unique elements.

## Creating a Type-Erased Slice

- **eraseToAnyColumn()**: Returns a type-erased column slice.

## Creating a Column of the Same Type

- **prototype**: A prototype that creates type-erased columns with the same underlying type as the column slice.

## Creating Transformed Columns

- **map(_:)**: Creates a new column by applying a transformation to every element.

## Inspecting a Column Slice

- **name**: The name of the slice’s parent column.
- **count**: The number of elements in the column slice.
- **wrappedElementType**: The underlying type of the column’s elements.
- **argmin()**: Returns the index of the element with the lowest value, ignoring missing elements.
- **argmax()**: Returns the index of the element with the highest value, ignoring missing elements.
- **isNil(at:)**: Returns a Boolean that indicates whether the element at an index is missing.

## Accessing Elements

- **subscript(_:)**: Accesses an element at an index.
- **subscript(_:)**: Accesses a contiguous range of elements.

## Summarizing a Column Slice

- **summary()**: Generates a categorical summary of the column slice’s elements.
- **numericSummary()**: Generates a numeric summary of the integer column slice’s elements.
- **numericSummary()**: Generates a numeric summary of the floating-point column slice’s elements.

## Getting Statistical Values

- **sum()**: Returns the sum of the column slice’s elements, ignoring missing elements.
- **min()**: Returns the element with the lowest value, ignoring missing elements.
- **max()**: Returns the element with the highest value, ignoring missing elements.
- **mean()**: Returns the mean average of the integer slice’s elements, ignoring missing elements.
- **mean()**: Returns the mean average of the floating-point slice’s elements, ignoring missing elements.
- **standardDeviation(deltaDegreesOfFreedom:)**: Returns the standard deviation of the integer column slice’s elements, ignoring missing elements.
- **standardDeviation(deltaDegreesOfFreedom:)**: Returns the standard deviation of the floating-point column slice’s elements, ignoring missing elements.

## Describing a Column Slice

- **description**: A text representation of the column slice.
- **debugDescription**: A text representation of the column slice suitable for debugging.
- **customMirror**: A mirror that reflects the column slice.

## Comparing Two Column Slices

- **==(_:_:)**: Returns a Boolean that indicates whether the column slices are equal.

## Modifying a Column Slice with a Value

- **+=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column slice by adding a value to each element.
- **-=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column slice by subtracting a value from each element.
- ***=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column slice by multiplying each element by a value.
- **/=(_:_:)**: Modifies an integer column slice by dividing each element by a value.
- **/=(_:_:)**: Modifies a floating-point column slice by dividing each element by a value.

## Modifying a Column Slice with a Collection of Values

- **+=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column slice by adding each value in a collection to the corresponding element in the column.
- **+=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column slice by adding each optional value in a collection to the corresponding element in the column.
- **-=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column slice by subtracting each value in a collection from the corresponding element in the column.
- **-=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column slice by subtracting each optional value in a collection from the corresponding element in the column.
- ***=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column slice by multiplying each element in the column by the corresponding value in a collection.
- ***=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column slice by multiplying each element in the column by the corresponding optional value in a collection.
- **/=(_:_:)**: Modifies an integer column slice by dividing each element in the column by the corresponding value in a collection.
- **/=(_:_:)**: Modifies an integer column slice by dividing each element in the column by the corresponding optional value in a collection.
- **/=(_:_:)**: Modifies a floating-point column slice by dividing each element in the column by the corresponding value in a collection.
- **/=(_:_:)**: Modifies a floating-point column slice by dividing each element in the column by the corresponding optional value in a collection.

## Hashing a Column Slice

- **hash(into:)**: Hashes the essential components of the column slice by feeding them into a hasher.

## Supporting Types

- **ColumnSlice.Element**: The type of the column slice’s elements, which is an optional type of the parent column’s type.
- **ColumnSlice.Index**: The type that represents a position in the column slice.

## Instance Properties

- **missingCount**: The number of missing elements in the column slice.

## Default Implementations

- **BidirectionalCollection Implementations**
- **Collection Implementations**
- **CustomDebugStringConvertible Implementations**
- **CustomReflectable Implementations**
- **CustomStringConvertible Implementations**
- **Equatable Implementations**
- **Hashable Implementations**

## Typed Columns

- **Column**: A column in a data frame.
- **FilledColumn**: A view on a column that replaces missing elements with a default value.
- **DiscontiguousColumnSlice**: A collection that represents a selection, potentially with gaps, of elements from a typed column.
- **ColumnProtocol**: A type that represents a column.
- **OptionalColumnProtocol**: A type that represents a column that has missing values.

## Conforms To

- BidirectionalCollection
- Collection
- ColumnProtocol
- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomReflectable
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- MutableCollection
- OptionalColumnProtocol
- RandomAccessCollection
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
- Sequence
